newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Bank BNI rises on debut.
newsitem.headline: Bank BNI rises on debut.

text.p: Giant state-owned Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) surged on its debut on Monday after it was heavily oversubscribed during its offer period, brokers said.
At 0330 GMT, BNI stock was trading a 1,225 rupiah against the offer price of 850 rupiah and topped the active list with 145.6 million shares traded. It had risen to 1,300 rupiah earlier.
A total of 4.34 billion shares were listed on the Jakarta and Surabaya stock exchanges on Monday.
The bank offered one-fourth of its equity, about 1.08 billion shares, to the public during the offer period from November 4 to 7.
PT Danareksa Sekuritas, the lead underwriter, announced on November 15 that the stock was oversubscribed 4.46 times during the public offer.
Brokers predicted the stock will be traded in a range between 1,200 rupiah and 1,300 rupiah during the day.
"There is large selling pressure at the price of 1,275 rupiah but I believe if it can pass that resistance level, there is room to increase," a local broker said.
